metadata.title: JBA Speed Shop TUNED the '71 Chevelle to 581HP! - (INSANE DYNO PULL!)

sections: Perfect classic styling paired with menacing modern power.
During the era of muscle cars, many bowed down to
. Here we he have a chance to call one your very own, but this fine example is far from factory.
is excited to offer this stunningly sinister
with that perfect classic styling but packed with modern components including a supercharged powerplant that will leave everyone in the dust.
Gleaming in a glossy black finish,

was given an exceptional frame-off restoration and packed with modern components. A set of 3-piece Forgeline GA3C wheels sit on all corners and come wrapped Michelin Pilot Sport tires. Wilwood front disc brakes help bring this powerful restomod to a halt.

is as powerful as it is beautiful. The heart of the beast is a modern fuel-injected LS1 V8 engine from Chevrolet Performance topped with an LSA supercharger. A T56 six-speed manual transmission shifts power through an LS7 clutch and down to the 12-bolt Detroit Truetrac posi rear end with 4.11 gears. Approximately 66,000 miles were accumulated on the LS1 motor before installation. Mechanical highlights include a new Nick Williams throttle body, black Holley valve covers, Edelbrock headers, a custom radiator, and a custom 3-gallon coolant reservoir to keep everything running cool. The car also features an LSX Concepts race drive front accessory drive that was powder-coated black to match the engine bay. Quenching the thirst of the car is a new Walbro 455 fuel pump with new fuel lines, a Ricks stainless gas tank, and a new fuel pressure regulator. This combination that generates a pavement-stomping 581-horsepower after being tuned by JBA Speed Shop in San Diego and put on the dyno.

Harnessing that power and planting it to the ground is the modern suspension system with upgraded sway bars, tubular front control arms, Belltech 2-inch drop spindles, and QA1 components such as adjustable rear upper bars, coil-overs on all four corners, and no-hop bars. Equipped with power steering, the car was given upgraded steering linkage with Borgeson components.

Behind the doors is an immaculate interior that still has the classic touches of American Muscle paired with the feel of a modern luxury sports car. complete with luxurious power leather seats sourced from a Cadillac CTS so you'll sit comfortably at any speed. Also inside this beaut are Autometer gauges, a suede Sparco steering wheel. Your favorite tunes can be played through an Alpine sound system complete with Bluetooth connectivity and hands-free phone technology. Keeping the cabin at that perfect temperature is the Vintage Air system with both air conditioning and heat. You can check out the
would look perfect in your garage, check out RestoMods.com and get double the entries for their 10th giveaway car. Go ahead and enter today for this
. Who wouldn't want to wake up to this car waiting to offer thrill rides everyday?
